review: Hooked it up in 5 minutes..Good quality..Does not connect to 5Ghz Wi-Fi...only supports 2.4GUpdate:Works with 5GHz WiFi with the current FW.Compatibility with LG UB9200 65" UltraHD TV.I have connected the Amazon Fire TV stick to one of the HDMI ports of my 65" LG UltraHD TV UB9200 . The SMPLINK (a.k.a HDMI CEC) feature of the TV/fire TV stick whereby you can use the TV's remote to control Fire TV works with the Fire TV stick with one major Flaw. For the HDMI CEC to get activated, you need to power cycle the fire TV stick every time the TV is turned OFF and the then turned back ON.So if you are watching the Fire TV and then you turn off the TV and then turn it back on again, the CEC feature stops working. To make it work again, you will need to power cycle the fire TV stick too by disconnecting the usb charging adapter of the Fire TV and connecting it back again.This is a major Flaw and Fire TV stick needs to fix this,.
author: Kishore Karthikeyan

review: Great product! Easy installation and fun to use for all ages.
author: Avis

review: I really wanted to like the Fire TV stick.  I had no issues getting it connected or wifi dropouts like some of the other reviewers.  My issue is that the audio on the device is slightly out of sync with the video.  I've tried every audio setting on the device and also on my TV.  If I turn my TV on and off while a video is loaded the audio will correct itself.  As soon as I load a new video the audio will be off again.  This is true for Amazon Prime video, Netflix, or Flixter.  My DVD player that also plays Netflix and my Chromcast both have no issues on my TV.  I hope that there will be an update that makes it usable but as of now I'm very disappointed.

review: I bought it for our upstairs Viewsonic tv but it was incompatible and we got the HCDP errors many others have reported. It does work (for 2 days so far) on our Vizio family room tv. I then moved our old Roku upstairs And it works fine. Hopefully amazon will eventually fix all the issues with software updates and if so I will redo this review.
author: Scoutmaster

review: The stick seems to work well and is responsive. I like the remote control, the onscreen layout is very clunky and weak compared to the Roku 3. Channels, apps, and content are scarce and lacking. It does have a very limited selection of apps but does have Netflix and Hulu. lacking HBO GO and other channels. you have to scroll to the left and right through each app and this is annoying and can take time. would also be nice if you use the USB output from your TV to power the stick but it requires you to use the included ac adapter. Overall the Fire TV stick is okay for the money. we will have to see long term how the content and interface progresses. if you are looking for more content, polished interface and more options for steaming your own media go with a Roku 3 or chromechast.
author: rick alvarado

review: Nowhere in the ads do they show, or say that you will need to connect the stick to a power source. My tv is on the wall with all the wires hidden, so trying to connect this to a power source with the short cable they give you is not a good solution. Very disappointed.
author: L. Fuentes "LGF"

review: It works and it is small.  Audio comes ONLY off HDMI, so it must plug into your audio system - if plugged into TV, you get only TV sound, wow.  I also have an AppleTV, this is not the experience that the AppleTV offers.  It also does not stream off ethernet, only Wi-Fi; the AppleTV can use either and also has a digital audio output, should you need it (or HDMI).  So not too impressed except now I can get jerky Wi-Fi of Amazon programming, should I need it, whenever that would be.  There are better options.
